name: Cullen International
goal:
Cullen International tracks, reports and benchmarks developments in telecommunications, media, postal and digital economy regulation across Europe, in Latin America, the Middle East and North Africa.

It provides monitoring services, neutral and independent analysis, benchmarking of national regulatory situations and practices, research tailored to individual needs and training programmes.
Clients include over two hundred key industry players and public organisations spanning the whole communications industry.

Cullen International does not engage in lobbying activities, nor does it represent the views of any of its clients.
interests: Borders and Security, Competition, Consumers, Culture, Culture and media, Digital economy and society, General and Institutional Affairs, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Single market
euInitiatives:
-European Electronic Communications Code
-Cross-border parcel delivery services
- Copyright in the Digital Single Market (DSM)
- Cross-border portability of online content services
- Copyright for certain online transmissions of broadcasting organisations and retransmissions of television and radio programmes
- Audiovisual media services in view of changing market realities (AVMS review)
- Contracts for the supply of digital content
- Consumer law review
-Goods Directive
-Digital Content Directive
-Geo-blocking Regulation
-Copyright reform
-e-Privacy Regulation
-Free Flow of Data Regulation.
